remarks: If a continuous mapping to a T_1 space is constant on a dense subset, it is constant on the entire space.  Note that ` ( ( cls `` J ) `` A ) = X ` means " ` A ` is dense in ` X ` " and ` A C_ ( ``' F " { P } ) ` means " ` F ` is constant on ` A ` " (see ~ funconstss ).  (Contributed by NM, 15-Mar-2007.)  (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 21-Aug-2015.)
statement:
dnsconst.1 $e |- X = U. J $.
dnsconst.2 $e |- Y = U. K $.
dnsconst $p |- ( ( ( K e. Fre /\ F e. ( J Cn K ) ) /\ ( P e. Y /\ A C_ ( `' F " { P } ) /\ ( ( cls ` J ) ` A ) = X ) ) -> F : X --> { P } ) $.
